Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery belly amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of horse (four locks of horse's mane with swathe of added red remaining) to right; part of panel frame to left.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see the amphora in Boston, Museum of Fine Arts, inv. 63.2401, Birchall 1972, 50, no.4..
Bibliographic references: Birchall 1972 / Attic Horse-Head Amphorae (p. 48, p. 50, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0002) (Phase 1)
